column1: Maardu is a town and a municipality in Harju County
column2: Estonia. It is part of Tallinn metropolitan area. The town covers an area of 22.76 km² and has a population of 15
column4: the largest cargo port in Estonia

column12: 0.2% Germans and 0.1% Jews and 1 Cuban. The proportion of Estonians was one of the lowest (if not the lowest) in Central and Western Estonia.

column2: south of the road to Narva lies Maardu manor
column3: one of the oldest preserved baroque manor houses in Estonia. It traces its origins to 1389
column4: but the current building dates from the 1660s with additions made in the 19th century. The landlord of the manor Herman Jensen Bohn in 1739 funded the printing of the first bible printed in Estonian.

column1: Maardu may be divided into four parts:
Kallavere (the centre of the city where most of the public institutions are located)

column2: now a light residential suburb more connected to Tallinn than Kallavere)
